body:
If that's the case perhaps the guides should be updated with what you said here. The reason behind this change is that I was trying to look up whether it not it is my responsibility as a contributor to create/request a backport but I couldn't find that anywhere. As long as there is something in the guide that points one way or the other I'd be pretty happy.

On 2012-05-22, at 1:36 PM, Rafael Mendonça França<reply@reply.github.com> wrote:

> I don't think that this should be in the guide. Backporting or not is a decision of the Rails team and change in the guide is supporting that the contributors have this decision.
> 
> If a bugfix is a candidate to backport, the Rails team member have the responsibility of take sure that it will be applied in the others stable branches.
> 
> With this change in the guide I'm seeing a lot of pull requests backporting things that should not be backpoted.
> 
> ---
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/rails/rails/pull/6447#issuecomment-5858134
